intro: Schistocarpha matudae, commonly known as Matud's thimbleweed, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in compact clusters. Schistocarpha matudae is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
